title: How do we tell whether a redox reaction is acidic or basic? - Quora

response.answer_text: Redox is an oxidation - reduction reaction, where both of them are taking place. From reaction mechanism, you can tell whether “the reaction is taking place in a acidic or basic medium” ( if H+ is present during balancing the reaction then it's acidic medium, and if OH- is present then it's basic medium). But as per my knowledge, you can't say whether “the reaction is acidic or basic.”

If you have a balanced equation and you see hydrogen ions, hydronium ions or the formulas of acids, then it is taking place in acidic medium. If you see hydroxide ions or the formulas of bases , then it’s probably taking place in basic medium. If you’re performing the reaction, you’ll know because you added an acid or a base. If it’s a “balance this redox equation” problem from your teacher, the information is usually given in the problem.
